p:
Comparison of the Drosophila α-synucleinopathy and tauopathy datasets revealed that proteins with altered expression in the two neurodegenerative disease models were largely distinct (Fig. 3a), consistent with the many clinical and neuropathological differences between α-synucleinopathies and tauopathies. Some proteins showed shared regulation: 132 of the 476 proteins upregulated in α-synuclein flies were also upregulated in human tau transgenic flies, while 101 of the 563 downregulated proteins in α-synuclein expressing flies were also reduced in human tau transgenic flies (Fig. 3a). GO analysis was performed to characterize shared and distinct pathways. Interestingly, mitochondrial function and immune response pathways were altered in both disease models (Fig. 3b). Both of these pathways have been implicated in α-synucleinopathy and tauopathy pathogenesis previously by our group and others
17, 36, 37 .
